seo.title: Career coaching for sustainable change
seo.description: SustainSage offers thoughtful coaching for people navigating transitions, relocations, and re-entry moments.

hero.title: Coaching to help you move forward with clarity
hero.description: Work with an ICF-aligned coach to map your next step without burning out or losing what matters to you.

image.alt: Coach and client in a calm conversation by the window

services.description: See example scenarios first so you can confirm fit before diving into process, pricing, or agreements.

cards.title: Graduate start
cards.description: Turn scattered efforts into a clear story and small, testable steps.

cards.title: New to the UK job market
cards.description: Translate overseas experience into local proof points you can show.

audiences.title: Mid-career professionals
audiences.description: People with 8–15 years of experience who need a reflective space to decide what stays, what shifts, and how to pace change.

audiences.title: Career changers
audiences.description: Professionals translating experience between countries or industries who want calm structure to test new directions.

audiences.title: Parents and community builders
audiences.description: Graduates, working parents, or carers aligning work with values while balancing caregiving and leadership.

audienceSection.title: People who find this space helpful
audienceSection.description: These are the contexts we hear every week. Each link shows scenarios, boundaries, and ways to start.

fitChecklist.title: 10 practical questions to check fit
fitChecklist.description: Each prompt comes from real client concerns so you can judge whether this space meets your needs without leaving the page.

items.question: Q1｜If coaching weren’t an option, what would you do?
items.answer: You could Google, watch videos, or talk with friends. Coaching matters when you already want change but feel stuck in real-world constraints like language, status, family, culture, or age.

items.question: Q2｜Why me, not any generic coach?
items.answer: I live the UK restart reality and don’t sell hype. I use structured thinking—breaking down money, time, status, family duties, and skills—so you can see your options clearly.

items.question: Q3｜How am I different from other UK-based Chinese/Taiwanese coaches?
items.answer: I focus on mid-career, returners, and complex family/visa contexts. I bring cross-cultural, family, and startup layers, and I’m careful not to overpromise—ideal for people allergic to success-theatre.

items.question: Q4｜What visible outcomes appear after 3 months?
items.answer: (1) A decision map with money/time/risks/emotional costs. (2) Executable rhythms and boundary scripts. (3) Written self-definitions you can revisit—not just “more confidence.”

items.question: Q5｜Why is pricing defensible?
items.answer: You are buying 3–6 months of critical-transition support, not hours. A mis-aimed career or migration decision is far costlier than the fee; steady decision quality is the value.

items.question: Q6｜Who will feel safe with my style, who may not?
items.answer: Style: calm, deep, structured, and honest about limits—no hype. If you want to be pumped up fast, this isn’t it. If you want frank conversations and steady pacing, you’ll feel held.

items.question: Q7｜What proof points can be verified?
items.answer: Work across Taiwan and the UK, family and migration experience, entrepreneurship, plus downloadable tools (boundaries practice, time logs, emotion maps) and named frameworks.

items.question: Q8｜If I only share three USPs, what are they?
items.answer: Cross-cultural, mid-career, family-responsibility realism; no dream-selling—acknowledge limits but keep moving; structured thinking with concrete tools, not just chat.

items.question: Q9｜If another coach looks similar, how do I shore up trust?
items.answer: Build trust with content and transparency: show session cadence, assignments, and tools; say clearly what coaching won’t cover and offer referrals when therapy or other help is safer.

items.question: Q10｜Most candid reminder and next step?
items.answer: No one pays because I try hard; they pay when I’m the best person to help them decide and endure right now. Write out the three typical clients, their pains, fears, and 3/6-month shifts, then weave that into the site, service pages, and first-call opener.

recognise.title: You might recognise these moments
recognise.intro: Short prompts from real conversations so you can sense whether the rhythm, tone, and care fit what you need.

items.title: Relocating to the UK
items.description: You are learning new workplace norms while supporting family in another timezone.

items.title: Re-entering after care leave
items.description: You want to return without losing the agreements that protect your household or health.

items.title: Speaking multiple languages
items.description: You switch languages mid-sentence to capture nuance and want a coach who can hold that pace.

items.title: Balancing visas and identity
items.description: You are weighing sponsorship timelines, belonging, and what leadership looks like in a new system.

items.title: Catching burnout early
items.description: You notice signals of exhaustion and want experiments that protect energy before things fracture.

image.alt: Notebook and tea on a table to reflect

key_points.title: What you will notice in early sessions
key_points.description: Example-led conversations keep decisions grounded before we layer on more structure.

items.title: Calm, practical sessions—no hype, no guarantees.
Try free tools first and keep what genuinely helps.
Weekly rhythm with small experiments between sessions.
Clear boundaries and confidentiality, explained up front.
Simple pricing with space to pause between blocks.
Cross-cultural, mid-career, and family realities: every tool considers visas, language, and care pressure.
No dream-selling: we acknowledge constraints and find the next viable step without success-theatre.
Structured thinking + downloadable tools: decision maps, boundary scripts, and checklists you can see.

process.title: How we will work once it feels like a fit
process.description: We stay example-first while moving into agreements, cadence, and review points.

steps.title: Explore
steps.description: What matters, why now, and what a good outcome looks like for you.

steps.title: Try
steps.description: A 20-minute conversation to sense chemistry, scope, and accessibility needs.

steps.title: Align
steps.description: Goals, boundaries, and cadence before any paid work begins.

steps.title: Work
steps.description: Weekly sessions plus short reviews and experiments between calls.

boundaries.title: Boundaries we keep visible
boundaries.description: These agreements protect pace, wellbeing, and confidentiality.

items.question: Is this coaching or therapy?
items.answer: Coaching, not therapy—we will signpost therapy when that is safer for you.

items.question: What are our time expectations?
items.answer: We start and end on time so you can plan around sessions with confidence.

items.question: How do you handle notes and data?
items.answer: We keep minimal notes and delete them on request within agreed retention windows.

items.question: Who sets the pace?
items.answer: You set the pace; we provide structure and accountability without pressure.

faqTeaser.title: Questions about how coaching works?
faqTeaser.body: Read about session rhythms, pricing, ethics, and how we tailor support for individuals and organisations.
